website_summaries.verdict: The TP-Link AV1200 Powerline Starter Kit delivers solid wired Ethernet connectivity to any area of your home without having to run wires.

customer_reviews.title: Good networking solution, but dont expect anything like 1200 Mbps
customer_reviews.text: These provide stable, fast data connectivity by sending encoded ethernet over your domestic mains wiring. The advertised speed is however a theoretical maximum that noone will ever see in real life. First, the signal degrades over distance. Any household appliance sharing the wiring creates interference which further degrades the signal. Strong RF can also do this. Finally a portion of the remaining bandwidth is used for the carrier protocol so is not available for actual data. In practice I get about 500Mbps speed, so probably around 450Mbps of data transfer. This is still faster than my broadband, so this is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good and stable
customer_reviews.text: Good and stable. Had it cut out a couple of times where I was required to take it out the socket and plug it back in. Other than that no problems. Please note, if your connect device(s) are not seeking ethernet connection from this then they auto hibernate to save electricity. Not a product fault. Would be nice if they made that clear for people who may be unclear.
customer_reviews.author: MikaelAnderson

customer_reviews.title: Good price and good product. On my house wiring I am seeing about 820MBit between these two adaptors
customer_reviews.text: Good price and good product. On my house wiring I am seeing about 820MBit between these two adaptors. They do seem to offer some features like VLANs which I will configure and use in time but will be useful! They don't appear to get hot, only warm to the touch. For me, having the ethernet cables come out of the top and the device having and upward orientation works well for my sockets as I had 0 space below. Using the passthrough power socket is very useful and is secure and good fit for UK plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Simon M

customer_reviews.title: Been in place for a couple of weeks now, ...
customer_reviews.text: Been in place for a couple of weeks now, Very quick install as long as you pair them on sockets near to each other before moving to desired location. Currently they are both plugged in downstairs and speedtest shows our Virgin connection getting 195Mb. We get 205 when connected directly into the back of the superhub. I imagine speed will drop when I move one upstairs, I'll post the figures for that in a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: ceejay

customer_reviews.title: Too unreiable - waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately while the set-up was easy, and it worked well for a while, the 8030P is just too unreliable to be useful. My old Netgear was rock solid reliable, just not fast. This TP-LINK drops its connection frequently, spoiling your online TV viewing and forcing you to reset the device before trying to restart the programme. The latest firmware makes no difference. A waste of £80+ for me.
customer_reviews.author: GreenGuy

customer_reviews.title: Work really well.
customer_reviews.text: Work really well. No freezing or anything. Have multiple devices going through them and around the house to my TP Link BB router. These are excellent. Increasing from 100mbit to 300mbit drops 1gb transfer time between PCs from about 7.5 minutes to the time it takes to copy from 1 HDD to another HDD in the same PC. So, no bottle neck. After 10 or more years of TPLink I now trust them fully. Great brand and very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: #Deleted

customer_reviews.title: Getting the full 100Mb/s advertised using these - highly recommend with the above caution
customer_reviews.text: These items work very well, with one REALLY BIG caveat: if you are running VDSL2 (fiber internet for Ireland & UK, probably other countries), you must not have an adapter beside the DSL wall port! If your DSL signal cuts off seemingly randomly when downloading, try repositioning the adapter into another power socket further away. Have gone from cutoffs any time I was downloading anything over powerline to full fiber speed throughout the home. Getting the full 100Mb/s advertised using these - highly recommend with the above caution!
customer_reviews.author: T Horny Marcobian

customer_reviews.title: Just plug and go!
customer_reviews.text: These just work! It's so nice to buy something, plug it in, and it just works without fiddling about. I'm only using two channels at the moment. One is connected to my router upstairs and the other is in the lounge with a 1M cable to my PC and a 10M cable to the TV. Both have 1Gb Ethernet running without a problem. Such a huge speed improvement over my previous 200Mb/s set.
customer_reviews.author: Culluding

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected at full speed!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected at full speed! I have one PA8010kit patched directly to the router, and have successfully added these to my existing powerline setup using the utility with ease. I can fully utilize the entire 1250+ Mbps bandwidth and can pull the whole 220Mbps downstream and 20Mbps upstream with my Virgin fiber connection. I've never had any connection issues with TP-Link and only trust this brand for my powerline setup. Using one of these for my PS4, Xbox One and laptop, and the other is for yet another PS4 and other potential devices once my friend moves in!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic - especially if you're a twitch/ youtube livestreamer!
customer_reviews.text: I've been running a 15M ethernet cable through the house for the past two years to connect my PC to the internet. So to tidy everything up I bought this and now have my PC/ PS4 with internet using the power socket right next to me! I livestream from my PC so I needed something reliable that wouldn't dip on performance. There isn't any Q or A's about these for livestreamers, so for those peeps out there who livestream to twitch or youtube you can do so and definitely won't lose out on any performance. I hit my full download and upload. (checked on speedtest.net)
customer_reviews.author: Jenko90

customer_reviews.title: Works so easily
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I used this product to extend an existing TP-LINK Powerline network. It was easy. Press 'pair' on the original unit I installed that connects to the home router via LAN, then press 'pair' on the new unit after plugging it in (no need to pair the existing installed units again). The new unit connected within seconds. While it's rated at 1200Mbps, I'm getting network speeds of between 500-600Mbps which is enough for my requirements. I guess network speeds are simply a reflection of the home wiring and the appliances connected to them. I have a lot of inverter appliances which would probably affect power quality with harmonics etc.. resulting in lower bitrates. Overall, I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN STEED

customer_reviews.title: When Working It Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Two months on I find the product can be quirky and you lose connection. M/soft W10 trouble shooter says it does not recognise the IP code. Swap the plugs around and it works and when it works its a very good connection and provides machine move ability without wifi . That said but I am glad I retained my old ethernet link when this device falls over. Simple, follow the quick set up instructions and you have an encrypted, fast Ethernet link. The only wrinkle regarding additional pdf guides resolved within a day.
customer_reviews.author: Ossian

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and works a treat
customer_reviews.text: Not too sure why some other reviewers have had issues with these. I plugged one in my router, the other downstairs and pressed the pair buttons on both and they linked straight away. The one that is downstairs is plugged into a double wall socket that does not have anything else plugged into it to stop any interference. Connection speed it better than my previous power line adaptors and the main reason i upgraded was i needed 2 ports downstairs, one for my tv and the other for sky. Not had any issues with connection dropping out but if i do i will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: winkyjeff

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says with minimal fuss, just make sure you secure the network!
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Quite big though, especially if you then plug a transformer into the plug as you then have about 4-5 inches of plug poking out of the wall. IMPORTANT - Make sure you change the network ID otherwise anyone else with these along your street can see and access your network. When I plugged mine in, I could access two other household's networks as they hadn't done this. The instructions don't clearly explain this, they only let you know you 'can' do it, not that you 'should' do it, and don't use an obvious network name.
customer_reviews.author: BPerry

customer_reviews.title: Adapters work very well and the installation was easy.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a pair of AV1200 adapters (TL-PA8010PKIT) to make a wired ethernet connection at home. Adapters work very well and the installation was easy. Now I can forget the problems with WiFi, poor signal level, overcrowded radio channels. Regarding the throughput, I made a quick check, copying the file from my laptop to network storage. It shows around 140-150 Mbps, enough to cover my needs. (NB the speed could be limited by my hardware or power circuits, as one of the adaptors connected with an extension lead).
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: ... already had a devolo 1200AC starter kit and I liked them so much I wanted more 1200 AVreplacements for ...
customer_reviews.text: I already had a devolo 1200AC starter kit and I liked them so much I wanted more 1200 AVreplacements for my old 200AV Devolos. These are not as eyewateringly expensive as the Devolos. These Tplink ones perform well and I love the three ports. They integrate well in the same dlan. I found the easiest way to set them up with the same encryption was to use the Devolo's web-user-interface. Just pick "add device" and type the code from the back of the tplinks (wwww-xxxx-yyyy-zzzz) and it will configure the tplinks quickly. Will I spend the extra down to replace the last 200AV Ones? Maybe.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use with Virgin Media streaming to the TV
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because my Virgin Media TV box was being upgraded to the V6 and my current powerline adapters were a bit old and not fast enough. Plugged in these new ones and the speed was great, worked perfectly. My Virgin Media router is in a different room to the TV but these adapters allowed that to continue and saved me a lot of potential work. Very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: John Philcox

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works
customer_reviews.text: I've had mixed experiences with this, when it's operating well I get great speeds throughout the house, good solid connection and I don't have to worry about it. However every 3 weeks or so it will drop the connection (and the middle light will go out) irretrievably until I power cycle both units. The same thing happened with the last tp link pl devices I bought. This product didn't have a Mac version of the power line utility, so you need to get one for another model. However the Mac version of this software is a massive resource hog do be careful. I'm probable going to return this because it's a real pain
customer_reviews.author: James Ward

customer_reviews.title: Cause too much radio interference
customer_reviews.text: These seemed to work great.... until I had to call out the BT Broadband engineer because our broadband was running so slowly (20Mbps rather than the 76 we're paying for). He proved that these were causing huge amounts of radio interference and preventing the broadband from working reliably, so I've had to stop using them. I'm not sure if it's because they're TP-Link, or because they're AV1200 - I don't have any other AV1200 devices to compare. However, I do have several other AV500 devices round the house that aren't causing a problem, and have had to buy another couple of AV500 devices (non-TP-Link) to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Little

customer_reviews.title: Ok Product, Better After Firmware Update Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Only Annoying thing is it doesn't seem to stay in the plug socket, and speeds seem to go up and down and require the unit to be turned on and off a lot, and pushed into socket, before speeds seem to resemble a direct ethernet connection. Not sure if it is because product is getting old. Not the 2000 as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Postings

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: What can I say other than I plugged into into a socket near the router and connected them up. I then plugged the other into a socket in another part of the house and connected the pc and it worked immediately. There was no difference in the performance of Fortnite connected remotely or directly to the router so the boys were happy
customer_reviews.author: R. Pinches

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable but flawed
customer_reviews.text: Fast and reliable but flawed. These powerline adapters are just what you need for a stable and fast connection. I easily obtained over 150Mbps on my 150Mbps Virgin Media connection. However there is one major flaw which stopped me using them. They are so big that they near enough cover the switch on a standard UK plug socket. This means that you'll be using the tips of your fingers to try and get to the switch and turn them on or off. I eventually sold these as this was a pain.
customer_reviews.author: D Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Simply doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Received. Quick and easy installation. Get on the internet to try a test download, really fast speed ... then after 5 minutes, it totally disconnects. Annoying. Reset both adaptors. No joy. Reset and re-paired after too much running up and down the stairs for my liking. Ah, connection is back. Try again. Same conditions, exact same result. Fast speed, disconnects after 5 minutes. Deep breath. Reset, re-pair. Try again. Same. Back in the box, returning. Not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: on the18th Feb 2016 I defy anyone to better that service
customer_reviews.text: I have an early version 200mps has been solid from the day I fitted it she is going into my garage to extend my Wi-Fi signal, he big sister is going in the house to feed my TV, TiVo box, and a spare connection. I have every faith in TP-Link over the years I have purchased many different products. I must also comment on the delivery I ordered this product at around 4.00 p.m. on the 17th Feb 2016 and it was delivered to me home at 12.15 p.m. on the18th Feb 2016 I defy anyone to better that service. Thank you TP Link and Amazon UK your the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Bought various devices from other manufacturers that didn't work in our house - with large distances from top to bottom. Then we were recommended this TPL series. We have been running them for 2 years with never an issue and now have four spread across different floors of the house. They just work consistently without issue,
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E Turpin

customer_reviews.title: Very easy set up and good speed
customer_reviews.text: I can't say that these are any faster than a AV1000 or AV500 homeplug unit for my flat but I can say that they definitely are not a bottleneck. The passthrough sockets are very useful and the set up is extremely easy. You plug them in, press a button for a few seconds wait a few more seconds then they work. What I really like about them is that I can turn one of them off when it is not needed and still not have any issue when it is turned back on. My old AV200 DLink pair would loose connectivity if I did that regularly like I do with these.
customer_reviews.author: Only me

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Pay the extra!
customer_reviews.text: Quick background... Paying for Fibre - down 100mbps up 20mbps Connected to AirPort Extreme Gbp port going upstairs to my office/lab environment and then connects to a to link 8 port gbp switch. I was using the 500mbps for ages and only topping 30mbps down although my up was consistent at 20mbps. Finally took the plung and switched to these.... 85 to 95mbps down, that is including my VM infrastructure on my server and a consistent 20mbps up! All I can say is if you are an IT pro or just hate it when you don't get what you pay for (internet speed wise) these are for you! Pay the extra and future proof also :)
customer_reviews.author: Richard Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Things I like: It is well made out of quality plastic. The LEDs are bright enough to be visible without being too bright. The pass through and the triple ports are useful. It is quick Unfortunately: It drops the connection several times a day, which my old and slower Solwise AV200 didn't. TPLinks technical support is pretty poor. I've a friend who is going to try them but I suspect they will end up in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: David Milne

customer_reviews.title: Completely happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Completely happy with this. Used it to bridge my broadband to my PS4 and smart TV. Gets my full FTTC broadband speed to the ps4 no problem (as it should, with this spec!) Initial pairing was a bit weird, it wouldn't work until I put both units in the same double socket, but once it was paired I put them in the final position and they worked fine. Two ethernet cables in the box which is handy.
customer_reviews.author: xyz574

customer_reviews.title: I used these to replace a cheap couple of AV500 ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these to replace a cheap couple of AV500 and my real life connection went from circa 50Mb per second to slightly over 150Mb (tested through wi-fi, so it might be higher via lan). My house is rather recent built and the utility says the connection between the two is around 600Mbps. I've had these for a few weeks and the connection has been very stable, also with the latest firmware from April 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Gaetano C

customer_reviews.title: Good, when it works.
customer_reviews.text: Lives between fibre terminal and bt hub. No other adapters plugged in, clean mains. No problem with setting up and average speed. But it drops the connection far too often. Not noticeable for browsing, but can't play anything like bbc iplayer or else over network for more than 20 - 30 min without dropping off the feed. Won't recommend for playback over network. Update: after 5 month the average speed dropped to 385Mbps which is less than 50 MBs. Resets, firmware, different sockets Nothing helps. Unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the box - very well!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this three port system to replace an aging two port system and it worked perfectly on installation, which was very easy to carry out. It also found, and paired with, an existing TP Link WIFI extender that had been previously fitted. Excellent product at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Pineman

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Not reliable at all. Disconnects A LOT. (multiple times a day). Sometimes need repairing to each other, requiring me to walk around the house to reset them both. TP-Link aware of problems yet do nothing to resolve. Unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not use near any hi-end audio equipment
customer_reviews.text: Although these are easy to set up and function as described they create excessive mains 'noise' which can affect other sensitive electronic devices. Especially high end audio - The TP-Link products issued 'fluttering' and low dysrhythmic 'pop' sounds. In my case my phono stage was adversely affected. Having contacted the hi-fi manufacturers [thinking the fault was with the hi-fi] both recommended another brand of Powerline and the problem was instantly resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Great product - annoying SW update process
customer_reviews.text: Works really well and I love the fact that it has 3 ethernet ports on each unit. The only criticism I would have is that the process to update the firmware of them is not very clear and unnecessarily complicated (for example finding the correct SW online is not straight forward). This meant I never did update them as I couldn't be bothered. Then again as I've not had any problems with them - so it might not be needed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ernbert

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. I have a few of these around the house, including other brands but they all seem to work together. Get nowhere near 1,200MBPS, so I do not need this high spec but it was cheaper than the 1,000MBPS one for some reason. Get a faster speed than with WIFI. Fet a long ethernet cable, such aswhich costs less than £2 for 5m cable you can set yourself up in any room!
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Bunny

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link 1200 works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly this is only week one, but the TP-Link 1200 works like a charm. The upload/downloads are virtually the same, i.e., direct from router or from the plug. When I tried a speed test I got download/upload 158/10.12Mbps from the plug and 162.80/10.03 Mbps direct from the router. I can now have wired internet anywhere in the house with minimal (if any) loss of speed. It also comes with 2 x 2 metre ethernet cables. Cons: it gets quite warm and covers the plug switch, but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Simon M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Better than others
customer_reviews.text: These have a great range and work well. Having three sockets means that they are very much more useful than the one socket version. Quick and easy to set up. Remember will not work if they are separated by an RCD or RCBO so they should be ideally on the same ring main or at least on the same part of a "split board". I am using a pair over 100m of 4mm SWA and it gives great results on two HD webcams attached at the far end. Always connects, never any issues, smooth feed with decent frame rate.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. H.

customer_reviews.title: TV and turbo!  (but note that these are not the wifi version!)
customer_reviews.text: The shed is connected! I was a bit worried that the length of cable, and different circuit might cause a stir but it is brilliant. I made a mistake in buying these because I had actually wanted a built in wifi thingy, and because the general faff of sending back and it being something that was utterly my fault for buying I swallowed my pride and rigged up a redunndant BT home hub as a router and voila. Wifi in the shed. Yay.
customer_reviews.author: Bo-peep

customer_reviews.title: After a series of problems losing my connection a few times a night I moved the TP-LINK away from the socket my Virgin router wa
customer_reviews.text: To long didn't read: I now get 1Gb reliably I've been using these a few weeks now. After a series of problems losing my connection a few times a night I moved the TP-LINK away from the socket my Virgin router was plugged into and now everything is working fine. Below I've listed a few things I found: Remember to change the default password! Connecting them back to back during configuration. I got 100Mbs Connecting one upstairs and one downstairs going along a long route. I got 450Mbs (Not reliable) Connecting the same as above but on the other side of the room upstairs I got 1Gbs. (So try other sockets if you're having problems)
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fickle connection
customer_reviews.text: One of the most frustrating products I have ever bought. I purchased to extend broadband from one end of my house to the other which it did do to some extent. Speed drops by 80-90% when measured from the router to end device and the connection fails and impairs itself regularly. It's fine if you want to unplug and re-pair each time this happens but most of the time it's a pain in the rear. I don't know if this is a common issue with these devices but I wouldn't consider buying them again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Worked with my Netgear 1200 powerline adapters ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Worked with my Netgear 1200 powerline adapters straight away with a push of a button. Performance is excellent, clocking 1GBps with the Netgear in the room next door, about 600-700 MBps with its brother and the other Netgear in rooms further away. The gigabit switch did it for me for a variety of esoteric reasons, really good feature. The value is ridiculously good given that these have a pass through plus gigabit switch and ports. Build quality is excellent. Notice that they are rather large hence why I went for the Netgears in tighter spaces. If this product sort of looks like what you are after then go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolaos Beglitis

customer_reviews.title: Flaky & Temperamental
customer_reviews.text: These can be very flaky & temperamental & can randomly connect/disconnect at anytime - they seem to go through periods where they can be nice & stable but then regularly cause issues/problems
customer_reviews.author: Bazzy

customer_reviews.title: Love these! High speed and high performance
customer_reviews.text: Love these! High speed and high performance, they've boosted my network speeds. Having the pass-through plug is very helpful, although the units are quite large. I'm considering buying some of the 3 ethernet port versions (otherwise identical) to allow me to have hardwire connections for all my media devices connected to my TV. If you've got a stationery mains-powered device on your home network (e.g. Apple TV, PSX, media centre etc.) then these give a far better connection than WiFi. Now I only use WiFi for devices that need to move around, e.g. phones, laptops, tablets etc.
customer_reviews.author: Atzan

customer_reviews.title: Faster and better looking than the BT version, three ports is a help too!
customer_reviews.text: Takes two mins to fit and noticeable performance improvement over my old BT units limit to 500, these are 1200. Ondemand TV got better. Sadly my BT TV box is still crap. Luckily I now watch Amazon and Netflix using my FireTV box now. Updated - worked fine for 6 months, now drops out every day and a pain in the ass to keep removing from the wall and then reconnecting. TP link help and support, said usual stuff then disconnected me. Not very good. Will try and get these replaced
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Great performer
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many different powerline adapters and brands over the years. This one is by far the best performer and provides a very stable connection without noticeable latency. Definitely better than any wireless connection could ever be, especially in big homes.
customer_reviews.author: Carsten H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Solved wiring problem
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Solved the wiring probelm for CCTV and TV connections. I have one in the loft connected with 8-port TP-Link POE switch for CCTV cameras. The other unit is in the living room connected with 4-port switch for TV, Amazon fire box, Welcome etc. The both units are in the extension still each give around 200Mbps. So far I did not notice any stability issue. The units are large. I had to turn the switch ON position before connecting to the extensions. Personally, I do not see any problem as the units only take only small power.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the performance which is generally around 450-650M between ...
customer_reviews.text: I now have 4 of these units running for several months, having upgraded from AV500 ones. Happy with the performance which is generally around 450-650M between units. So much easier than running cables around the house! They can be affected by electrical noise, some cheaper LED bulbs can impact performance so worth monitoring this when introducing new bulb types.
customer_reviews.author: Dave L

customer_reviews.title: Plug in, pair up, job done
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install, does the job just fine as far as I can tell. When pairing another unit, plug it into a socket near the existing one (tip from TP-Link), so both pairing buttons are accessible and all their LEDs can be seen. I have 2 more of these, single port, altogether now supporting router, NAS, Sky box, streamer, WDTV media player. No problems after 5 weeks or so. Using the TP-Link utility, the best speed is currently between router and NAS (about 650Mbps), lowest is around 300Mbps to a streamer that only needs 320kbps anyway right now. Streamed radio & Spotify is now more stable than via WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to network cables
customer_reviews.text: Simple plug and play - linked in to an existing setup. Using for Apple TV and Smart Blu-Ray and streaming is excellent. However the network speed is only as good as your house wiring and broadband speed. If using in a new build house should be fine but old period house if not done already would benefit with a wiring upgrade...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tehver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speed and value - just expect a fraction of the quoted speeds
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent, speedy Powerline adapters! As long as your expectations are set appropriately, you'll not be disappointed with these adapters. They are quite chunky - covering the switch on a dual power socket, but once in place off a stable and fast network across home wiring. These are rated at 1200Mb/s but mine max out at about 250Mb/s. Entirely expected, though, given the wiring in my house! They replaced some 600Mb/s Powerlines and are significantly quicker.
customer_reviews.author: mroshaw

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical about buying one of these and worried that the wiring in my house would be capable of getting the speeds metioned. No need to worry though as it works fantastically well. So simple to install and it was up and running in only a couple of minutes. Wish I'd have bought one of these sooner, but I decided to sink a cable into the wall when we moved into our house. This cable used to just plug into one device, but now with multiple devices added with a switch, I needed a better solution. This was/is it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great product for anyone looking for a wired connection
customer_reviews.text: Great product for anyone looking for a wired connection. One WiFi plug goes into the wall by your router & connects to that via ethernet cable & the other goes into the plug socket of the room you want to have a better connection & wires to your devices & you're good to go. You can plug a surge protector with extra sockets if you need more too. Would recommend to anyone wanting to get the best wired connection.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Now I can fully use my broadband at home!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought two of this and now have 3 wired connection to 3 different rooms. The performance is impressive, I have 76mbs BT infinity at home and tested it with one of the rooms. It is showing download speed of 74.83 Mbs.... I am therefore fully utilizing the internet speed available to me and because the TV, and two laptops are now using wired connection, I put less pressure on the Wifi network and they have a smoother connection now! Happy days all round! I used to have 11 devices connected through my Wifi and now is down to 6.... !
customer_reviews.author: Gareth

customer_reviews.title: Works in every room in the house
customer_reviews.text: Works really well around the house. We use these in 3 rooms. They work all the time and allow users to take the socket from one room to the next with no problem. Wifi can be turned off at night as the house has cable in every room we wanted it in.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: These are so simple and work well.
customer_reviews.text: Previously had several other makes that required software to set up which could be hit or miss. These are so simple and work well. Lights are discrete. Pass through is a must to utilize the socket
customer_reviews.author: MIZNOMA

customer_reviews.title: Vast improvement
customer_reviews.text: I was getting poor Wifi strength to my TV,PS4 and Sky box which was making streaming apps distort and crash and when downloading HD content to the sky box, it would strangle the bandwidth so that other wifi devices would get nothing at all. Speeds are now great and in turn has relieved pressure from my Wifi making it more reliable for other devices. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rich J

customer_reviews.title: A great power line adaptor three outputs very useful (I link ...
customer_reviews.text: A great power line adaptor three outputs very useful (I link smart TV, Sat box and a link to computer from one socket) they transmit very fast are stable and reliable a good buy if a bit expensive but worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Colinz

customer_reviews.title: A review of the one port AV1200.
customer_reviews.text: A review of the one port AV1200. I've been using 500 speed units for a while now, but they were not quite up to the job. I live on a 3 storey house. I have many Blu-ray Discs ripped to NASs on the ground floor which I need to stream to a media player on the top floor. The 500s were almost up to this, but not quite. The video would usually play, and usually stutter and stop. I replaced these 500 units for the 1200s which I'm reviewing. Immediately the speeds I was getting doubled. Even films with a high bitrate play every time and without stuttering. Extremely simple to use - quite literally plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Better with an unswitched single socket
customer_reviews.text: It is bigger than I expected and for my socket that means the switch is covered. I also presumed it swivelled so the ports could face under rather than over. It would be neater and less obtrusive. It does appear to be the best way to get a Sky Q and Smart Tv to work if other devices need wi fi access.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Victor Clark

customer_reviews.title: Works great with all new and old devices
customer_reviews.text: Works amazingly in my heavily WiFi congested apartment building. As an added bonus this works with all my older power-line adapters in the apartment too, allowing me to plug this into the wall by the router and provide the gigabit network to all my gigabit devices and still have my 100Mb devices be provided for as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Works well for VDSL2 speeds, no fuss
customer_reviews.text: I use this to connect two Apple Airport Extremes across my house to get full wifi coverage (one downstairs, one upstairs, opposite corners of the house). I haven't benchmarked how fast they really go but they will easily use the full 73mbit/sec of my VDSL2 line which is what I wanted them to do. I've had some bad 500mbit based kits like this in the past (including a Devolo which died in a puff of smoke) so I'm really impressed that these can do the job with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: LinuxJedi

customer_reviews.title: Worked out the box, and quick too.
customer_reviews.text: Worked out the box, and quick too. I have one plugged in to my broadband router, and the other connected to a LAN switch in my home office, i.e. this carries internet traffic only and it's certainly fast enough for that. I haven't tried to measure how fast, but I'm delighted with these. Do check out the size of these units to make sure that they will physically go where you want them to - they are quite large.
customer_reviews.author: R. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, plug and play, well made
customer_reviews.text: They deliver significantly faster speed than my previous 500mg plugs. It's very handy to have the 3 ports as so many electronic items need a firewire connection these days. Very good for streaming video and with the three ports you can plug in a a variety of boxes such as a smart TV, Sky and Apple TV without a separate router at the TV end. If you need more than two the version with the single port is cheaper and you only really need a single ethernet port on your main router end.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Great powerline!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have WiFi so not sure why it is one of the options for the review but it works easily allowing my pc upstairs to receive fast ethernet signal from the router downstairs!
customer_reviews.author: Amit L.

customer_reviews.title: Good fast connection
customer_reviews.text: Very good powerline adapters. I’ve been using these for several months now and they provide a good fast connection in our large house (direct distance between the two units is approx. 18 m, no doubt the cable distance is considerably longer). I recently added a third unit to connect to a room on the first floor and this works very well too.
customer_reviews.author: Dr J.G. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Speeds
customer_reviews.text: I have used homeplugs for years and never really achieved there speeds I wanted from these devices. I understand speeds are dependant on wiring quality in your house or home, but these new home plugs from TP link are superb. I am getting approx between 500mbps and 650mbps which has transformed my house which always had spotty WiFi signal in certain areas. Top 5 be stars to TP Link on these devices.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: They work OK most of the time. They seem to have a common fault, which I have read about online, where you lose internet connectivity randomly. If I am online for a number of hours, you could be disconnected at least 6 + times and each time can stay off for about 2 - 3 minutes. This happens every day, it is not like it only happens once a week.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Work OK and have no issues other than they get ...
customer_reviews.text: Work OK and have no issues other than they get a bit hot. Not had to reboot them since install many months ago. Speed OK to support 3 HD IP cameras.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Remember to use the passthrough on your adsl hub to improve speed by reducing power noise
customer_reviews.text: Very Good compared to older versions. I had the older version of the TP-Link power adapters, i find this version much more stable and the speed you get is very fast, your internet connection will be the bottleneck so dont worry too much about what internal speed you get. Its VERY useful to plug your nearby power devices into the pass through, in particular hub power supplies that can be "noisy" this isolates the noise from the network.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gardiner

customer_reviews.title: Dont use if you have a hi fi system
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem with this power line is the noise it makes on the house Electrics I wanted to replace my Met Gear and D-link Powerlines which don't interfere with my Hi Fi. and monitors.This dose and makes music unsustainable. .So returned it to Amazon...No Problem
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace existing PowerLine connectors which (a) were only 300Mbs and (b) didn't have a mains plug "pass-through" socket. The originals were used to connect 2 routers in the house to provide good Wi-Fi access throughout. Whilst they worked, connecting to Wi-Fi via the slave router gave significantly slower internet speeds than when connected to the master router. These new ones have given a significant increase in speed - we now get the same results with broadband speed tests from both master and slave routers - and the "pass-through" socket has helped tidy up the installation of the slave router. Just waht I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Flipman51

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link signal Boost.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, inserting these took me from 170 Mbps to a whopping 1 Gbps and the fact they have a pass-through socket means no outlet is wasted. Simple to install, I even have faster downloads to my smart TV from my SkySTB! As one Ethernet outlet is only available you can use this in one, end, for a laptop and even plug in your laptop to the same socket then move the laptop around the house, as long as it is on the same ring main
customer_reviews.author: Mr. David B. Sears

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, solved the issue I had with connection
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, solved the issue I had with connection, would have 5 stars but sometimes signal cuts out, it could be my router or these, however these work the vast majority of the time and are easy to use, the seller sent ASAP, excellent servcie.
customer_reviews.author: GBaingu

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. With the AV500 my downloads where capping at 40-50mb, now able to get the full 75mb of my internet connection. The data rate reported by the powerline utility was showing about 120mbs with the av500, its showing 300mbs with the AV1200. My only criticism so far is the design compared to the AV500, its bigger and extends upwards which i think looks kindof ugly with a cable coming out the top. Plus it partially obscures the socket switch.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Easy to set up with two at once, but adding more after caused a few initial problems, but fortunately it was sorted. The increase in speed over AV1200 can vary - the difference between one lot of pair was an increase of 104Mbps, whilst another was 746Mbps Will be interesting to see if these occasionally lose connectivity (possibly the sleep system is activated and not waking up).
customer_reviews.author: BurpyMcFistyGuts

customer_reviews.title: Good product. 5 stars if it got closer to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works straight out of the box and when connected to a network that already has lower specification models. So far I have never seen more than 400Megabits across my power system and the typical speed is only a little more than the 500 model devices connected to the system before this was bought but it is a little faster. Good product. 5 stars if it got closer to actually delivering Gigabits on an uncrowded network.
customer_reviews.author: KNBD

customer_reviews.title: Does the job brilliantly!.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job brilliantly! ... With the router being downstairs at the back of the house and my Android TV box being located upstairs at the front of the house the wireless signal was simply not strong enough to stream HD TV channels and movies without constant drop in connection. These powerline adapters have resolved the problem. I am now able to connect my Android TV box to the powerline adapter by ethernet cable which creates a wired connection and after testing the internet speed I can confirm that I now get near perfect internet speeds and therefore no more drop in internet connection while I am streaming live TV.
customer_reviews.author: Gemma L

customer_reviews.title: Nice but they aren’t really the answer because they go ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice but they aren’t really the answer because they go bad intermittently. The connection light flashes red and finally goes out. The network is lost. It isn’t a faulty unit: I have enough of these to swap around. The problem is intermittent. I guess that running networks over mains is always going to be a bit of a gamble.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewC

customer_reviews.title: I'm converted!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been quite sceptical of powerline systems but I have been impressed with these. They have meant that I have been able to avoid an awkward LAN cable run between my study and lounge. As is always the case, the transfer rate figures aren't even close to what speeds you actually see, and I find them more reliable than using a WiFi repeater system. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AndytheWake

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to sort out a BT TV issue with subscribed channels. The picture was unwatchable with this, it was all scrambled blocks most of the time. I complained to BT about the quality and they sent me a couple of gigabit power line plugs of their own brand and they worked perfectly. So have returned the TP Link gigabit adapters for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: pr1970

customer_reviews.title: Don’t really understand how it works but I’m suitably impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Few slight problems with pairing to existing TP-Link power line installation but now working perfectly and much faster than I was expecting. I get around 125 mbps connected ethernet direct to router and around 95 mbps through these. Don’t really understand how it works but I’m suitably impressed.
customer_reviews.author: BeeFarmer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product to get net through to a hard to reach area
customer_reviews.text: Hasn't failed me once. Love this product. I use all 3 ports on the output and have 1 port used on input. I have Console, Laptop and Android media center linked up to it, all 3 running at once and not noticed any issues. O and the fact you dont loose a plug is just a huge bonus.
customer_reviews.author: WelshTony1

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I got BT TV recently and kept getting frozen pictures and error messages. I didn't realise that the old Powerline adaptors, which linked my upstairs router with my downstairs BT TV box weren't fast enough to cope with HD channels. Bought these and the signal problem has gone.. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: KenP

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but not as good as they say...
customer_reviews.text: endless problems and drop outs - slow speeds and one of the unit (bought 2 x 2) failed completely.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Fish

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, great product.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for the obvious reason. Specifically for connecting my modem to my router which has my desktop and two NAS stations attached. It does the job beautifully and allows a huge bandwidth that I don't see maxing out any time soon. Easy to setup and get going, takes around 2 minutes if that. A brilliant product and you can't go wrong with this 1200Mbps version.
customer_reviews.author: Ev

customer_reviews.title: works very well but dont expect the full 1200mb/s unless ...
customer_reviews.text: works very well but dont expect the full 1200mb/s unless your possibly in a brand new house, on the same ring and with no interference. the gigabit plus speeds are in ideal conditions which almost no one out of the companies lab actually has. If your in a average home, expect 400- 800 mb/s, more than enough for gaming or 4k video streaming. will be ordering more in the new year to expand my network :)
customer_reviews.author: OBi-D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gigabit Wi-fi signal extender
customer_reviews.text: These work fantastically well, I was sceptical that these would work, but they do and very well.my son always complained about the Internet dropping out and poor connectivity whilst gaming on the Xbox and PC.Poor signal is now a thing of the past I now get no complaints from the gaming room and the Internet is now streaming music,movies and online gaming perfectly, I would highly recommend these fantastic gizmos.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: ... year ago and forgot about them - network works great, very fast
customer_reviews.text: plugged them in almost a year ago and forgot about them - network works great, very fast, no issues! One is downstairs beside the router and the second upstairs. As soon as I plugged them into the wall sockets they found each other immediately and the one upstairs now works as a second (wired) router.
customer_reviews.author: Yanni D.

customer_reviews.title: I Haven't measured speed but it works fine and gives two advantages
customer_reviews.text: I Haven't measured speed but it works fine and gives two advantages; passthrough and a built in Gb switch. The sync button could be made to stick out so one could feel it when it can't be seen, it is too flush for my liking. I could only get it to work with AV200 if I connected that to Router non Gb and this to Gb outputs, then it is fine, in effect two networks in one so to speak.
customer_reviews.author: Enonod

customer_reviews.title: Working superbly for game streaming!
customer_reviews.text: Super quick adapters. I know certain types of these can be quite slow but these provide me with my full 150mbps internet connection. I also use these for Nvidia game streaming to my shield TV and I get a 2ms latency with no packet loss, I tend to use Moonlight on my Shield TV as I can increase the connection quality to 100mbps 1080p/60fps without a hitch so I'm really happy. A lot of this depends on your wiring in your house though, so it could be that I'm quite lucky in that respect, but either way they do the job I needed them for superbly and I can't fault them.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Did not seem to work, and would constantly lose connection.
customer_reviews.text: Did not seem to work, and would constantly lose connection. I'm not a networking idiot but could not get them to keep a steady signal between house plugs. Returned these and replaced with a competing brand which work much better. Noticed other reviewers mentioning this stability/disconnect issue, and appears TP-Link have no real fix. Glad to know I wasn't the only one experiencing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are very easy to set up and are more than fast enough ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very easy to set up and are more than fast enough to keep up with the Internet and local data transfers. They will typically drop the connection once or twice a day for some reason, but wait a minute and they come back online. Was already expecting that from other reviews though.
customer_reviews.author: Adasha

customer_reviews.title: speeds aren't amazing, you'll never get anywhere near the numbers rated ...
customer_reviews.text: speeds aren't amazing, you'll never get anywhere near the numbers rated on the packaging so the entire concept and product naming convention is completly misleading. The units reckon they communicate at 300-400Mb/s between floors, but i can't get a data transfer rate beyond 12MB/s(96Mb/s), tempted to just run a cable instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The dogs whatsits!
customer_reviews.text: When I asked my husband to rate these he named a part of a dogs anatomy. He’s scarily enthusiastic about these things (not the dogs bits). Thinks they are great, good quality and work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up, flawless connection: 1Gbps to a router downstairs. Worked through a power extension cable. I was impressed, so bought another set to convert all my devices to powerlines! The only negative is the size of the plug doesn't allow you get to the power switch easily, but I doubt anyone would turn this off often.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in March, but I only start using it this Wednesday. I plugged both devices on the same room and the nightmare start... No Internet as all. Then I visited online the technical support, over the phone I just follow all the steps they ask me for and the problem was the same. On the same day I contacted Amazon for a replacement. The just order the collection and delivered another product on the following day. I took both devices from the box, and they started working perfectly well on the 1st connection. Thank you for this 5 star service
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Linhares

customer_reviews.title: They are quick chunky and can partially obscure the on ...
customer_reviews.text: They are quick chunky and can partially obscure the on / off switch on the plug plate - but they've been very reliable and speedy thus far. Think earlier versions had operation LEDs on the front - they're on the side with this version and frankly that's my only complaint as they can be hard to spot when you're setting up.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy and effective
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I'm the world's least technologically able person. This arrived when I was without the rest of my family and I set out with trepidation to do this. No kidding it was done in a minute. Literally, plug one unit into the wall, run Ethernet from your router to the thing, then plug in the other unit and Ethernet out. Done. Great speed.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs S McDonnell

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with that
customer_reviews.text: Managed to achieve a speed of about 350mb/s in a house with a distance of about 40ft as the crow flies. Faster than anything else but i'm dubious about the gigabit speeds. Maybe it's what i'm using I don't know. My PS3 achieves about 38mb/s instead of 8mb/s on wifi. I'm happy with that. No more buffering at least!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

product_meta.title: TP-Link TL-PA8030PKIT 3-Port Gigabit Passthrough Powerline Starter Kit, Data Transfer Speed Up to 1200 Mbps, Ideal for HD Video Streaming and Online Gaming, No Configuration Required, UK Plug
product_meta.description:
Size Name:AV1200| Style Name:3 Ports + PassthroughThe TL-PA8030P KIT AV1200 powerline kit extends your wired Internet access throughout your home. It provides up to 1200Mbps high-speed data transfer rates via your home's existing electrical wiring. 2X2 MIMO enables the TL-PA8030P KIT to communicate with multiple devices at the same time for more stable powerline speeds. With Gigabit Ethernet ports, you can connect smart TVs, game consoles and computers for seamless 4K streaming and lag-free gaming anywhere in your home. Also, it features two pass-through sockets, so you can use the socket as usual. Simply plug and play, no configuration required. It also uses power-saving technology to conserve up to 85% energy when not in use.

BOX CONTAINS


 * 3-port passthrough powerline adapter (TL-PA8030PKIT)
 * RJ-45 Ethernet cable
 * Quick installation guide
feature_bullets: Ultra-fast powerline speed, home plug AV2 standard compliant, high-speed data transfer rate of up to 1200 Mbps, ideal for ultra HD streaming and online gaming
MIMO technology, line-neutral/line-ground 2 × 2 MIMO with beamforming ensures fast and stable connection
Multiple gigabit port, provide reliable high-speed wired connection for game consoles, smart TVs and NAS and patented power-saving mode automatically reduces power consumption by up to 85 percent
Keep your outlet, an integrated socket lets you power regular devices as normal and a built-in noise filter prevents them from interrupting the powerline signal
Plug, pair and play, set up your powerline network and start enjoying fast, seamless wired/wireless connection in minutes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars547 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
